title: Sources: Burrow could need surgery for turf toe
content: Star Cincinnati Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow is dealing with a turf toe injury that could need surgery, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Sunday night.

title: Cowboys sign Clowney to boost depth, says Jones
content: The Cowboys have signed three-time Pro Bowl edge rusher Jadeveon Clowney to a contract, owner Jerry Jones said after the team's overtime win against the Giants on Sunday.

title: Extra-motivated Lions hang 52 on Johnson, Bears
content: In a game they called "personal," the Lions scored 52 points on former offensive coordinator Ben Johnson, whose Bears dropped to 0-2 in his first season.

title: Steelers rookie rues key kickoff 'mistake' in loss
content: The Seahawks rallied to beat the Steelers on Sunday, with a pivotal miscue by rookie Kaleb Johnson -- who allowed a kickoff to bounce over his head and into the end zone that was ultimately recovered for a TD by Seattle --  proving costly.

title: Stewart nets 18, hurts knee in Liberty's G1 win
content: Forward Breanna Stewart scored 18 points before injuring her knee with 3:01 to play in overtime, and the New York Liberty defeated the Phoenix Mercury 76-69 on Sunday in Game 1 of their best-of-three first-round WNBA playoff series at PHX Arena.

title: Raleigh makes more HR history; M's atop AL West
content: Mariners slugger Cal Raleigh hit his 54th home run, tying Mickey Mantle's record for a switch-hitter and passing Javy Lopez's mark for catchers in a season (43).

title: McDaniel not worried about job as Fins start 0-2
content: Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel isn't worried about his job security, despite his team's 0-2 start to the season.

title: Ohtani's lawyers move to dismiss real estate suit
content: Shohei Ohtani and agent Nez Balelo moved to dismiss a lawsuit filed last month accusing them of being the reason a Hawaii real estate investor and broker got fired.

title: üèÜ Eagles' petty posts top Week 2 trolls
content: The San Francisco 49ers also made sure to poke fun at the New Orleans Saints after winning on the road, topping Week 2's NFL trolls.

content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 2.

title: Debating Week 2 overreactions: We make sense of the Lions, Cowboys, Eagles, Chiefs
content: Do the Cowboys have playoff hopes? What's up with the Super Bowl duo? We sized up Week 2 overreactions.

title: Your guide to Sunday's first-round WNBA playoff games: Matchups, storylines, more
content: The Lynx, Dream and Liberty each lead their series 1-0. Here's what we're looking forward to Sunday, plus our postgame takeaways.

title: WNBA playoff surprises: Why Dream, Mercury, more could crash the championship party
content: There's a clear three-team title race. Here's how the other five teams could make deeper runs than expected.

title: Late rally seals Kroger Queen City title for Charley Hull
content: Charley Hull, coming off a runner-up finish in Houston last week as part of the Aramco series on the European tour, took advantage of top-ranked Jeeno Thitikul's final-hole putting meltdown on Sunday to win the Kroger Queen City Championship in Ohio.

title: Manchester derby reaction: How City beat United, Donnarumma and Haaland dazzle, more
content: Man City outclassed Man United in Sunday's derby, fully deserving their 3-0 win. Here's what you need to know from the fun at the Etihad.

title: Liverpool rely on late-game heroics to deliver another win
content: For the fourth straight game, Liverpool left it late for victory. Is that the sign of a Premier League champion?

title: Ranking Week 2 fantasy football winners and losers and injury impacts from Sunday
content: A summary of Week 2's best and worst fantasy performances, biggest storylines and historical perspective.

title: Fantasy Buzz: Bengals withstand Burrow injury, Lions offense roars
content: Jake Browning stepping in for an injured Joe Burrow and Mac Jones for Brock Purdy highlighted the early window.

title: College football betting: Can the Irish still win the national championship?
content: Pamela Maldonado explains why it might be too early to count out Notre Dame, even after the loss to Texas A&M dropped them to 0-2.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Is Carson Beck's stock trending back up at Miami?
content: Is Carson Beck rising in a wild QB class? Does Jordyn Tyson have challengers for WR1? We have updates on NFL draft prospects through CFB Week 3.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Barcelona track Palmeiras' Benedetti
content: Arsenal are ready to rival Barcelona for 19-year-old Palmeiras left-back Luiz Benedetti. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: Here's what we know about now-defunct Aspiration, the company at the center of the salary cap circumvention accusations.

title: üèà Ranking NFL QB debuts from Fields to Rodgers
content: Can Justin Fields and Aaron Rodgers sustain their great Week 1 play? Ben Solak stacks the top QB newcomers -- and begs the Giants to hold off on Jaxson Dart.

content: Even though Rob Ryan hasn't coached college football in over 25 years, he has already acclimated to life in L.A.

title: ‚öæ Why each MLB contender can win the World Series
content: Lack of power? Bullpen holes? Injured stars? Why each contender's biggest weakness will -- or won't -- sink them in October.

title: üî• Which CFB coaches are on the hot seat?
content: Who could be on the hot seat? Who are coaching candidates to watch? Our experts explain the current coaching landscape.

title: üèÄ Report links Kawhi's late pay to Clips partner
content: A Clippers limited partner invested $1.99 million in Aspiration nine days before the company made an overdue $1.75 million payment to Kawhi Leonard, according to a report.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Jags trade RB Bigsby to Eagles for draft picks
content: The Jaguars have traded running back Tank Bigsby to the Eagles for 2026 fifth- and sixth-round picks.

title: 10 tips to help you win your league this season
content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: 'Time for being soft is over': Trump reacts to Indian man beheading in Dallas
content: Donald Trump condemned the beheading of Chandra Nagamallaiah, allegedly by a Cuban "illegal alien" with a prior criminal record, in Dallas, Texas. Trump criticised the Biden administration's immigration policies, claiming the suspect should not have been in the country. He vowed to prosecute the killer to the fullest extent of the law and promised a tougher stance on illegal immigrant criminals if he were in power.

title: Onus on govt to ensure peace talks, say people in Manipur
content: While PM Modi urged Manipur to reconcile, Meitei and Kuki communities emphasize the government's role in facilitating dialogue to bridge the divide caused by ethnic conflict. Community leaders stress the need for political solutions rather than development packages, highlighting the complexities in achieving reconciliation and lasting peace.

title: A perfect demolition: No contest with bat or ball; India crush Pakistan
content: India demolished Pakistan by seven wickets in Dubai, reducing the so-called arch-rivalry to a mismatch. Kuldeep Yadav and Axar Patel wrecked the Pakistan middle order before Shaheen Afridi‚Äôs late blows lifted the Men in Green to 127/9. Abhishek Sharma‚Äôs blitz and Suryakumar Yadav's calm 47 not out sealed the chase with ease, amid added drama over India‚Äôs post-match handshake snub.

title: One man, six govt jobs ‚Äî cloned identity scam exposed in UP
content: A massive fraud in Uttar Pradesh's health department has been exposed, revealing how multiple individuals impersonated the same person, "Arpit Singh," across six districts for nine years. These impostors, using forged documents, collectively siphoned off approximately Rs 4.5 crore in salaries.

title: Handshake row escalates: Pakistan cry foul, lodge protest against India in Dubai
content: The India‚ÄìPakistan T20I ended in controversy after Suryakumar Yadav refused handshakes, citing solidarity with victims of the Pahalgam terror attack. Pakistan lodged a protest, alleging a breach of sportsmanship, while Salman Ali Agha skipped the presentation.

title: Gemini Nano Banana AI Saree: What it this new trend; How can you create photos
content: Following the Nano Banana AI 3D figurine craze, the 'Banana AI Saree' trend has emerged on Instagram. Users are transforming selfies into 90s Bollywood-style portraits using Google‚Äôs Gemini Nano Banana image editing tool. The AI crafts images with chiffon sarees, grainy textures, and golden-hour lighting, mimicking classic Bollywood aesthetics with popular styles like polka-dot and floral sarees.

title: Charlie Kirk killing: Kin says Tyler's partner 'hates conservatives & Christians'
content: A relative of Tyler Robinson's transgender partner revealed to Fox News Digital that he harbors animosity towards conservatives and Christians, suggesting a potential influence on Robinson's political views. The partner, currently not charged, allegedly exhibited increasing anger and radicalization in recent years. The relative believes the partner significantly influenced Robinson's behavior and views during their year-long relationship.

title: Dramatic 5 minutes in Dubai: Suryakumar snubs Pak's handshake, India shut door on opposition
content: India‚Äôs seven-wicket win over Pakistan in Dubai was overshadowed by a handshake controversy. Suryakumar Yadav refused customary pleasantries, calling it a ‚Äúproper reply‚Äù and dedicating the win to victims of the Pahalgam terror attack and the armed forces. Pakistan showed disappointment, with coach Mike Hesson revealing his side was ‚Äúready‚Äù to engage but left ignored.

title: Amazon suspends engineer: Sent 'threatening' letter to CEO Andy Jassy
content: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: 'Non-cooperative' Tyler Robinson under special watch
content: Tyler Robinson, accused of assassinating Charlie Kirk at a Utah Valley University event, is under special watch for a mental health evaluation. Following a 33-hour manhunt, Robinson was apprehended after his father recognised him in FBI footage and intervened due to suicidal concerns. Governor Brian Cox stated Robinson isn't cooperating, but his family and partner are assisting investigators, noting his deep leftist indoctrination.

title: Watch: 'We stand with victims of Pahalgam' ‚Äì Gambhir dedicates win to armed forces
content: India defeated Pakistan in the Asia Cup, a victory dedicated to the victims of the Pahalgam attack and in gratitude to the Indian Army for Operation Sindoor. Kuldeep Yadav's stellar bowling performance and Suryakumar Yadav's anchoring innings led India to a dominant seven-wicket win. This victory marked a significant moment, showcasing India's resilience and solidarity.

title: Caught on camera: 'I'm sorry I wasn't ready', Mark Zuckerberg tells Donald Trump,
content: At a White House dinner, Mark Zuckerberg was caught off guard when President Trump inquired about Meta's future investments. Zuckerberg, visibly flustered, committed to spending at least $600 billion by 2028, mirroring Apple's recent announcement. Other tech CEOs, including those from Google and Microsoft, also shared their substantial investment plans, primarily focused on AI and infrastructure.

title: Taylor Swift at Arrowhead: From secretive arrival to security concerns
content: Taylor Swift made a low-key entrance at the Kansas City Chiefs' home opener, sparking fan speculation. Unlike her grand Eras Tour arrivals, she discreetly entered behind a screen, avoiding the usual fanfare. This subtle approach highlights Swift's evolving relationship with the public, balancing her star power with a desire for privacy, leaving fans curious about her presence.

title: Will Travis Kelce play today? Injury update; Chiefs vs Eagles game status
content: Travis Kelce is set to play against the Philadelphia Eagles, despite a recent controversy. Kelce expressed frustration after colliding with Xavier Worthy in the previous game against the Los Angeles Chargers, leading to Worthy's injury. Kelce addressed the incident on his podcast, taking accountability for sidelining his teammate. The Chiefs aim to rebound from their loss against the Eagles.

title: Fans slam NFL: 'That wasn‚Äôt even a moment'; Charlie Kirk tribute at Lambeau
content: The NFL and Green Bay Packers honored Charlie Kirk with a moment of silence before facing the Washington Commanders. Fans called it rushed and poorly executed, slamming the league for inconsistency compared to past public statements. Kirk, 31, was killed Wednesday in Utah. The tribute came as Trump vowed to award him the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

title: Ricky Hatton cause of death: How did the English boxing legend die at 46
content: Ricky "The Hitman" Hatton, a celebrated British boxer, has died at 46. Police discovered his body at his home in Hyde, Greater Manchester, confirming no suspicious circumstances. The news arrives shortly after Hatton announced a comeback fight in Dubai, leaving the boxing world in mourning for the beloved champion who battled both inside and outside the ring.

title: Jade Jones shares a glimpse of her love life with Tyrese Haliburton on Instagram
content: Indiana Pacers' Tyrese Haliburton and his fianc√©e, Jade Jones, are sharing their romantic journey with fans. Following their engagement six weeks ago, Jade showcased her elegant gown on Instagram. The couple was spotted enjoying The Weeknd's concert alongside Kevin Hart. Haliburton, despite his injury, visited Iowa State University with Jones, passionately supporting the Cyclones.

title: Man abducted in road rage incident, rescued from Khedkar‚Äôs home
content: Rabale police have registered an FIR after a road rage incident led to the kidnapping of a cement mixer's helper by an SUV driver on Mulund-Airoli road. The SUV is registered under Puja Automobiles, linked to suspended IAS officer Puja Khedkar's Pune bungalow.

title: Congress shares excerpts of Nehru's broadcast to counter PM's claim
content: In response to PM Modi's criticism of Congress's handling of the 1962 Chinese aggression in Assam, Congress leader Pawan Khera shared excerpts from Jawaharlal Nehru's 1962 broadcast to the nation. Nehru's address reassured the people of Assam and the North East, pledging unwavering support and ultimate victory against the Chinese invaders.

title: 'Disappointed India didn't shake hands': Pak coach Hesson
content: India's Asia Cup victory over Pakistan was marred by controversy as Pakistan's coach, Mike Hesson, expressed disappointment over India's refusal to shake hands post-match. Despite Suryakumar Yadav's match-winning performance and dedication of the win to armed forces, the absence of the customary handshake and an anthem mix-up added fuel to the rivalry.

title: LeBron James marks 12th anniversary; shares romantic reel
content: LeBron James and his wife, Savannah, celebrated their 12th wedding anniversary, marking over two decades of togetherness. LeBron shared a romantic Instagram reel of them dancing, which was flooded with well wishes from fans. Savannah has been a constant support for the Lakers legend, and they continue to inspire many with their dedication and love.

title: 'I get a little clammy': Savannah James opens up; struggles with fame
content: Savannah James, wife of LeBron James, maintains a low public profile despite her husband's fame, expressing discomfort with red carpets and TV appearances. She prioritizes family privacy while supporting LeBron's philanthropic work and athletic dedication. Together since 2004, they navigate life in Los Angeles, actively supporting their son Bronny's basketball career.

title: Pak anthem blunder! Hilarious mishap stuns Dubai - Watch
content: The Asia Cup 2025 match between India and Pakistan faced an unexpected start in Dubai due to an anthem mix-up, causing visible confusion among Pakistani players. Hardik Pandya's historic first-ball wicket added to the drama after Pakistan won the toss and chose to bat. India capitalized on early momentum with key wickets, intensifying pressure on Pakistan's top order.

title: ‚ÄòSkyline of Gaza is changing‚Äô: Israel flattens 3 high-rise buildings in Gaza City
content: Intense fighting escalated in Gaza City as the IDF reported killing dozens of militants and striking Hamas infrastructure, including high-rise buildings. Palestinian sources reported numerous deaths from Israeli strikes, while over 300,000 residents have fled Gaza City following evacuation orders.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs security scare; concern grows; Kelce‚Äôs Chiefs face Eagles
content: Amidst heightened security concerns surrounding Taylor Swift, fans have expressed worries about her safety, particularly during Travis Kelce's games. A resurfaced photo from Super Bowl LIX highlights the constant presence of her security team, sparking debate about privacy and safety in society.

title: Joe Burrow out with toe injury; Jake Browning to start; Bengals QB update
content: Joe Burrow sustained a toe injury during Sunday's game against the Jaguars, leading to his exit in the second quarter. Backup quarterback Jake Browning stepped in, showcasing potential but also inconsistency. The severity of Burrow's injury is under evaluation, potentially impacting the Bengals' offensive strategy, with a more conservative approach possible if he's sidelined for an extended period.

title: Asia Cup: Comedy of errors! Nawaz makes a mess of easy catch
content: During the India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash, Mohammad Nawaz's comical dropped catch became a viral moment amid Pakistan's struggles. India's spinners, Kuldeep Yadav, Axar Patel and Varun Chakaravarthy, dominated, restricting Pakistan to a mere 127/9, despite Shaheen Shah Afridi's late hitting. India's bowlers seized control early, highlighting their dominance in high-pressure matches.

title: Israel's Qatar strike: Mossad refused to take part in ops - here's why
content: Mossad refused a ground operation targeting Hamas leaders in Doha. Israel opted for airstrikes. The strike aimed at key Hamas figures. However, it reportedly killed relatives, aides, and a Qatari officer. Internal conflict arose over the strike's timing. Some feared it would derail hostage negotiations. Israel cited a rare opportunity and recent attacks as reasons for the operation.

title: IND vs PAK: Shaheen, like his father-in-law Shahid Afridi, hits sixes for fun - Watch
content: In a thrilling Asia Cup 2025 encounter, Shaheen Shah Afridi's explosive late hitting evoked memories of Shahid Afridi, rescuing Pakistan from a batting collapse against India. His unbeaten 33 off 16 balls, including four towering sixes, lifted Pakistan to 127/9 after India's bowlers had dominated. Shaheen's unexpected batting heroics added a spark to the high-stakes rivalry.

title: Bigg Boss 19: Natalia Janoszek and Nagma Mirajkar eliminated; Awez Darbar breaks down
content: Bigg Boss 19 witnessed a shocking double elimination during Weekend Ka Vaar, hosted by Farah Khan, Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi. Nagma Mirajkar and Natalia Janoszek were evicted due to receiving the lowest votes, leaving Awez Darbar heartbroken.

title: Watch: Fired-up! Gambhir turns up the heat in pre-match huddle
content: Ahead of the high-stakes India-Pakistan T20 Asia Cup clash, coach Gautam Gambhir delivered a passionate pep talk, emphasizing pride and resilience. Pakistan opted to bat first, citing familiarity with the slow Dubai wicket. Political tensions lingered, evident in the absence of a handshake, but Gambhir's fiery words underscored the importance of mentality in this intense rivalry.

title: Fact check: Are heart attacks caused by bacterial infections?
content: A viral post suggests bacterial infections, particularly biofilms, may trigger heart attacks by causing inflammation and plaque rupture. Research indicates oral bacteria, like viridans group Streptococci, are found in arterial plaques of heart attack victims. Scientists are investigating how these biofilms activate and contribute to plaque destabilization and thrombus formation, potentially linking oral health to cardiovascular disease. Read more below!

title: Supreme Court To Rule On Pleas Against Waqf Amendment Act Today
content: The Supreme Court is slated to pronounce Monday its interim orders on three key issues, including the power to denotify properties declared as "waqf by courts, waqf-by-user or waqf by deed."

title: After Charlie Kirk's Killing, Growing Chorus Of Conservatives Wants His Critics Ostracised
content: After years of complaints from the right about "cancel culture" from the left, some conservatives are seeking to upend the lives and careers of those who disparaged Charlie Kirk after his death.

title: Alleged Charlie Kirk Killer Had 'Leftist' Beliefs, Utah Governor Says
content: The man arrested over conservative influencer Charlie Kirk's assassination was romantically involved with a transgender roommate and had "leftist ideology," Utah's governor said.

title: Keir Starmer Says UK Won't Tolerate Racial Intimidation After Far-Right Rally
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said Britain would not tolerate people feeling intimidated "because of their background or the colour of their skin" after a large far-right protest was marked by battles with police.

title: Navy Receives Indigenously-Built Anti-submarine Warfare Ship 'Androth'
content: The Indian Navy has received an indigenously-built anti-submarine warfare ship that is expected to boost its maritime prowess against the backdrop of China's growing forays into the Indian Ocean.

title: Finance Ministry Deputy Secretary Dies After BMW Hits His Bike In Delhi
content: A senior official of the Union Ministry of Finance died and his wife is seriously injured after a BMW car hit his motorcycle on Ring Road near Delhi Cantt metro station on Sunday, the police said.

title: "India Led The World, But Did Not Conquer Any Country": Mohan Bhagwat
content: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh sarsanghchalak, Mohan Bhagwat, on Sunday highlighted that India led the world 3,000 years ago, but didn't conquer any other country or suppress anyone's trade.

title: Audio Leak Reignites Row Over Congress Leader NM Vijayan's Suicide In Kerala
content: The controversy over the alleged suicide of former District Congress Committee (DCC) treasurer N M Vijayan in this hill district escalated on Sunday with the leak of an audio conversation between his family and Thiruvanchoor Radhakrishnan.

title: Stone-Throwing, Clashes In Manipur's Churachandpur After Arrests Over Vandalism
content: A group of people including teens in Manipur's Churachandpur clashed with the security forces as they sought the release of some of their friends who were arrested in an alleged vandalism case.

title: 73-Year-Old, In US For Over 30 Years, Detained By Immigration Officials
content: A 73-year old Sikh woman has been detained by immigration authorities in California after she went for a routine check-in with the US agency, sparking protests and concerns among her family and members of the community.

title: Eyeing Bihar's Yadav Votes, BJP Brings In Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister
content: As the high-stakes battle for Bihar heats up, the contest between the ruling NDA and the opposition INDIA Alliance has entered a decisive phase.

title: Delhi Max Temperature Settles At 34.4 Degrees Celsius, Air Quality 'Moderate'
content: The national capital on Sunday recorded a maximum temperature of 34.4 degrees Celsius, 2.1 notches above the seasonal average, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: BJP Leader's Order Against Muslim Salesmen At Indore Market Stirs Up Row
content: Indore's oldest and most popular Sheetlamata Market, known for decades as a hub for women's clothing, has now become the latest flashpoint of politics.

title: Missing Truck Driver Rescued From Sacked IAS Officer Puja Khedkar's Pune Home
content: A truck driver, missing after an accident with a car, has been traced to the Pune residence of sacked IAS officer Puja Khedkar, bringing fresh trouble for the former officer.

title: "How Can He Do It": Union Minister Loses Cool At Karnataka Cop Over Lathicharge At Ganesh Procession
content: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Saturday demanded the suspension of the senior police officer who ordered a lathi-charge on people who were part of the Ganesh idol immersion procession in Karnataka's Dharwad last week.

title: IndiGo Welcomes Its First All-Women Batch Of 33 Maintenance Technicians
content: IndiGo, India's preferred airline, marked the National Engineering Day by onboarding its first-ever all-women batch of 33 maintenance technicians.

title: Couple Dead, 3 Of Family Injured As Car Overturns In UP: Cops
content: A 60-year-old man and his wife died while three members of their family got injured after their car malfunctioned and overturned on the Delhi-Dehradun national highway in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Sunday, police said.

title: 'Have Courage To Question Islam?' BJP vs Siddaramaiah Over Conversion Remark
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's comment on conversion and the caste system in Hinduism has drawn a blistering response from the BJP, which quizzed him about equality in Islam and suggested that he "set aside" his "Leftist lens".

title: After Arrests Over Raipur 'Nude Party', Women's Commission Seeks Report
content: Police have arrested several suspected organisers after posters for an alleged "nude party" scheduled on 21 September in Chhattisgarh's Raipur went viral on social media.

title: London protests: PM Starmer condemns far-right rally; vows strict action
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: News: Jose Altuve leaves game early; Tarik Skubal sees good test results
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the new york Yankees will try to sweep the weekend set from the Boston Red Sox at Fenway Park . sportsmail's "sunday night baseball" returns with two familiar foes hooking up .

title: Indian Navy gets anti-submarine warfare ship
content: The name ‚ÄòAndroth‚Äô holds strategic and symbolic significance as it is derived from the Androth Island in the Lakshadweep archipelago, underscoring India‚Äôs commitment to safeguarding its vast maritime territories

title: Ilaiyaraaja accepts CM Stalin‚Äôs request to set Sangam literature to music
content: Music director A.R. Rahman, in a message, said Mr. Ilaiyaraaja had secured a special place for Tamil Nadu in the world of music. Mr. Rahman said Mr. Ilaiyaraaja‚Äôs Symphony would serve as an inspiration to any musician striving for excellence.

title: States should get compensation for GST revenue loss; eco growth should benefit all: Kerala FM
content: Kerala Finance Minister Balagopal emphasises passing on GST benefits to common people and warns of revenue loss impact on States

title: U.S. immigration authorities detain 73-year-old Sikh woman in California; family calls for her release
content: Harjit Kaur, who has lived in the East Bay in Northern California for more than 30 years, was detained by Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials during a routine check-in earlier this week

title: West Bengal records highest child marriages in India at 6.3%, reveals data
content: Even after a decade of dedicated schemes targeting elimination of child marriage in West Bengal like Kanyashree Prakalpa the state records very high incidents of child marriage both in rural and urban areas

title: White-coats walk out in protest: Chhattisgarh‚Äôs health workers are on strike¬†¬†
content: For nearly a month, Chhattisgarh health workers have been on strike, demanding permanent employment and better working conditions. This has burdened the already strained healthcare system in the State

title: Defence Ministry unveils new framework to streamline revenue procurement
content: The new manual will ‚Äòfoster jointness among the three Services‚Äô and is aimed at achieving self-reliance  in defence sector, said the Defence Ministry

title: Public transport is the only way to tackle traffic congestion, says Hyderabad Metro Rail chief
content: Architects should leverage their technical expertise to develop innovative ideas to tackle population growth, environmental degradation, pollution control and fast-paced urbanisation, says HMR managing director at All India Architecture Reconnect Summit

title: Drive to curb multi-layered plastic waste in the Nilgiris launched
content: As the first step towards identifying the companies that have the biggest footprint in products sold and waste generated as a result, a brand and waste audit has been conducted in Coonoor. The exercise will be done in Udhagamandalam and Kotagiri, too

title: Milad juloos winds through Hyderabad amid prayers and pageantry
content: Young men on two-wheelers, cars, lorries and even camels carried flags that signified the event; chants and slogans of prophethood were raised even as the procession moved towards the designated route

title: Protest turns violent in Manipur‚Äôs Churachandpur after police detain two for vandalising Modi cutouts
content: A mob protested near the Churachandpur police station against the detention of the two youths. Soon it turned into a clash between the mob and the security forces. The tension eased after the two were released

title: Sense of superiority based on birth should be continuously challenged, says new CPI State Secretary
content: M. Veerapandian argues that only the continuous inculcation of social science can bring about a meaningful change in society

title: Minority BJP government at Centre will not survive for long: Chief Minister Stalin
content: He says opposition parties have been claiming that the DMK has not fulfilled its poll promises as they are unable to accept that support for his government has been on the rise among the people

title: Residents call for change in ABC rules to curb stray dog menace
content: The council has come forward with a set of demands in the backdrop of the recent Supreme Court verdict allowing State governments to take appropriate action on the stray dog issue across the country

title: Over 3,000 cases settled in national Lok Adalat organised by DLSA in Malappuram
content: Two significant settlements were reached in cases involving loans from a nationalised bank in the district

title: Minister Anam Ramanarayana Reddy releases water from Somasila Reservoir to Penna River
content: The government is preparing plans to set up temple tourism parks across the district as per the orders of the Chief Minister

title: Half a century later, Short Service Officers still await pension justice
content: Emergency and Short Service Commissioned Officers, many now in their 70s and 80s, press on with a legal battle for benefits they say were promised in the 1960s

title: After killing minor children, man ends life and wife rescued
content: Caught in a debt trap over the medical treatment of a man who became bedridden after a road accident four years ago, a couple killed their two minor children and decided to end their lives

title: 'We welcome them': Trump calls on foreign firms to invest in US
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: Ahead of PM‚Äôs visit, Tejashwi Yadav makes surprise inspection of Purnia hospital
content: The leader of opposition in Bihar legislative Assembly pointed out that in the GMCH-Purnia, there is no ICU nor the cardiology department and even the trauma centre is not functional.

title: A.P. High Court Chief Justice stresses need to reduce gender discrimination
content: Despite progress over the years, gender discrimination and violence against women and girls have not been fully eradicated, says Justice Thakur

title: Amit Khare appointed Secretary to Vice-President C. P. Radhakrishnan¬†
content: Khare has been serving as Advisor to the Prime Minister since October 12, 2021, handling matters related to the social sector in the Prime Minister‚Äôs Office

title: Heavy rains, mudslides disrupt NH29; suspension bridge washed away in Nagaland
content: Landslides along the Mhainamtsii-Pimla road, an alternate route to Kohima, further disrupted vehicular movement

title: Women will shape vision of Viksit Bharat: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla
content: Conference in Tirupati stresses women‚Äôs literacy and reforms in legislatures; Andhra Speaker calls for ‚Äúno work, no pay‚Äù for MLAs

title: Internal reservation: Government in back-channel talks to convince nomadic tribes to withdraw protest¬†
content: The govt. is also mulling over a comprehensive special package for the microscopic communities, say sources

title: New CPI(M) committee office in Kannur to house historic ledger
content: The ledger, kept at the party district committee office Azhikodan Samaraka Mandiram, written by comrade Sreenivasan, who became the party office secretary in 1970, stands as a valuable testimony to the party‚Äôs legacy

title: Delhi govt. says free bus travel for transgender persons awaits Cabinet approval
content: HC disposes contempt plea but allows petitioner to revive case if proposal is rejected or delayed further

title: State sees over 500 organ pledge registrations in four days
content: Two back-to-back heart transplant surgeries were carried out in Kochi, on September 11 and 13, as organs were harvested from brain-dead patients in Thiruvananthapuram and Kochi

title: Secunderabad records 123 mm as heavy rains batter Hyderabad, trigger waterlogging and traffic chaos
content: Police personnel and HYDRAA teams were deployed across the twin cities to regulate traffic movement and clear waterlogging

title: Five arrested for selling painkiller tablets near Gudiyatham
content: Investigations revealed the gang was selling the tablets for youth and students in the area. Police seized the tablets, syringes and a two-wheeler from them

title: Crucial KPCC meeting to look into ‚ÄòMamkootathil controversy,‚Äô Wayanad organisational issues
content: Conclave takes place against the backdrop of ‚Äòfissures‚Äô within the Congress leadership over Mamkootathil‚Äôs suspension from the party. Party may launch revamp of digital media cell at the meet. It will look into developments in Wayanad following the suicide of DCC treasurer N.M. Vijayan

title: Government will not allow YSRCP implement its divisive agenda, asserts Andhra Pradesh Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar
content: Accusing the opposition party of creating discord in society through its social media, he says the government will firmly deal with those vitiating peace

title: Probe finds Parassala SHO responsible for fatal hit-and-run
content: District Police Chief (Thiruvananthapuram Rural) has recommended the suspension of P. Anil Kumar who failed to adhere to proper procedure after the accident. The SHO did not stop to assist the injured person or report the incident immediately

title: India brags about having 1.4 billion people but won't buy one bushel of U.S. corn: Lutnick
content: The United States Commerce Secretary made these comments in an interview when asked whether the U.S. was mismanaging valuable relationships with allies like India, Canada and Brazil with tariffs imposed on these countries

title: ED summons former TMC MP Mimi Chakraborty and actor Urvashi Rautela in 1xBet case
content: The ED had earlier recorded the statements of former Indian cricketer Shikhar Dhawan and Suresh Raina in the same case

title: Respecting the spirit of democracy is every citizen‚Äôs foremost duty, says officer
content: Bike rally as part of International Day of Democracy flagged off outside Sri Vijaya Vittala Temple at Hampi in Vijayanagara district

title: Watch: What the National Highway-2 reopening means for Manipur: Ground Report
content: The National Highway-2, which cuts through Kuki-Zo and Meitei areas fractured by ethnic violence since May 2023, is vital for movement of people and essential goods. The Hindu‚Äôs Deputy Editor Vijaita Singh reports on the impact of the reopening.

title: National Highway-2 is open but Kuki-Zos and Meiteis are not ready to hit the road yet
content: A central security officer posted at the Kangpokpi check point said, ‚ÄúSome Meitei people may try to travel clandestinely but there is no visible movement of people from the community taking this route. Similarly, the tribal Kuki-Zo people are not travelling towards Imphal valley‚Äù

title: Kerala to develop State-specific MOOC platform K-learn for four-year UG programmes
content: Envisaged to address inadequacies of existing MOOC providers, K-learn will provide free, credit-linked online courses

title: Decision on dividing metro rail projects into multiple packages likely on September 19
content: Andhra Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation Limited to take a call on bidders‚Äô plea to allow wider participation; the 46-km Phase-1 metro in Visakhapatnam includes a 20-km double-decker system

title: No uranium contamination in groundwater at Turakapalem, clarifies Health Department
content: The department, as part of preventive measures, has ordered officials concerned to ensure that water is being supplied through tankers in the village

title: Odisha teacher suspended for beating up 31 students for not touching her feet
content: ‚ÄúStudents were beaten with a bamboo stick. I personally found several with bruises on their hands. One child had to be given first aid, and a girl even lost consciousness briefly,‚Äù says Block Education Officer, who conducted inquiry

title: Ambiguity over Mamkootathil‚Äôs Assembly attendance
content: Speaker says there is no word on whether Mamkootathil will attend the Assembly. Congress leaders equivocal over the MLA‚Äôs presence in House. LDF places onus on Congress

title: Parliamentary panel suggests licensing requirements for AI content creators
content: Parliamentary Standing Committee on Communications and Information Technology also recommends mandatory labelling of AI-generated content and stronger measures against deepfakes

title: Residents, farmers oppose proposed Indosol, BPCL projects in Nellore district
content: Bharatha Chaitanya Yuvajana chief Ramachandra Yadav announces to go on a hunger strike along with the farmers if there is an attempt to grab their lands in Karedu

title: Priyanka Gandhi seeks explanation over death¬†of Congress functionaries in Wayanad
content: As many as four people committed suicide over the last two years allegedly due to factionalism within the party

title: Sena (UBT) stages protests against India-Pak Asia Cup cricket match
content: Protests held in different parts of Maharashtra; India and Pakistan will face off in Dubai, in the first match between the two sides since the military conflict in May

title: Andhra Pradesh Assembly Speaker advocates mandatory 60-day sessions for better governance
content: Ayyanna Patrudu raises concern over absenteeism in Andhra Pradesh Assembly, noting 11 YSRCP MLAs, including the party leader, frequently skip sessions

title: Kerala Police‚Äôs cybersecurity summit to focus on prevention of child abuse
content: Kochi will host the conference on October 10 and 11. Ahead of the meet, a 10-day training will be given for investigation officers of cyber units from all States at the Kerala Police Academy.

title: 1,500 tonnes of onion sold at auction in Kurnool
content: Anticipating huge arrival of onions to the market on September 15, authorities have declared closure of the market yard on September 16 to avoid inconvenience to the farmers

title: Virginia Tech fires Brent Pry: Top candidates, transfers and recruits to watch
content: the Virginia Tech Hokies fired coach Brent Pry after a 0-3 start to the season . Pry was supposed to represent a return to the Frank Beamer glory years in blacksburg . but a bowl game in 2023 and a faceplant to start this season closed the curtain for Pry .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Every game in the first round, starting Sunday
content: the WNBA playoffs kick off on tuesday with four games to play . the first round is a 1-1-1 format, with the higher seed hosting Games 1, 2, 5 and 7 . if necessary, the finals will expand to a best-of-seven series (2-2-1-1-1) format .

title: Ranking CFB's 39 unbeaten teams: Who is most likely to stay that way?
content: "slow down and take a look around" is the old Guy Fieri line from "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives" if you search, you'll always find a wild game worth watching . two of the sport's wildest rivalries, Pitt-West Virginia and Ole Miss-Arkansas, both gave us classics too .

title: AP Week 3 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: the latest AP poll is out . a trio of ranked matchups around the sport got the biggest wins of the weekend . the AP top 25 is based on a 3-0 week 3 result against Ohio State .

title: After defeating Canelo, is Crawford the best fighter of his generation?
content: Terence Crawford becomes undisputed champion in three weight classes . the 37-year-old beats canelo alvarez unanimously to become super middleweight champion . he enters an exclusive club as the first men's boxer in the four-belt era to earn undisputed status .

title: DeShaun Foster is out at UCLA; here's who could take over the Bruins
content: alum deShaun Foster was elevated late in the 2023-24 coaching carousel . the school fired Foster after an 0-3 start in which the Bruins were outscored 108-43 . he is a former assistant and standout running back in the NFL .
